item.title: Happy Winter Solstice!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Silver Lining:

Your messiah knew the laws of his religion. He just selectively broke them. And yes, I’m happier with knowledge. Sure, it’s depressing that people refuse to see the truth, but that’s just a natural protection from emotional and mental harm. Basically, the trinity is another way of saying that your god is a schizophrenic fuck. Theistic evolution? Genesis tells us that woman came from man’s rib. Find me some evolutionary feat that has involved any living organism coming from a fucking rib. Modern Christians have come up with this bullshit to avoid admitting science has disproved Jewish/Christian beliefs. The survival of Christianity is simply because it is so flexible. If we’re open about sex, Jesus can have fucked Mary Magdalene and whoever the hell else he wants. Finally, your god has emotional issues. He gets pissed over his creation and he seeks to destroy it. Way to be a team player, false god.

You amuse me.

fellixombc:

What are you guys pasters?

Lol pasters.

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Winter Solstice!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“dragonus18, post:17, topic:167284”]adam and eve vs evolution
god created earth in 7 days vs scientific explanation[/quote]

Theistic evolution.

[quote=“Buzzy, post:18, topic:167284”]I’ll give the two that I found when I was 11 years old and I started studying the bible.

Read genesis, it says that there were four people on earth when cain killed abel, correct? Well, how is it possible that cain killed abel and then left to marry a woman from another place, doesn’t make sense. I’ve heard that the counter argument to this is that in these times, daughters were not mentioned. I don’t buy that, when there’s 5 people on the entire planet, you better believe we’d account for everyone of them, not that we actually have any proof of “Adam and Eve”.

The second, and the one I found earlier on, in sunday school, is a weak hole, but a hole still the same. I can’t remember what book, but it says that jesus traveled to jerusalem with his parents when he was 12 years old, and they were walking through the city, when jesus left his parents, and went to a temple to preach to the religious people, I’m sure you heard this is where he magically picked out the scrolls of the torra as if he knew exactly where they were and preached the word. Well, what isn’t brought to your attention is that jesus left his parents when he was supposed to stay (yeah, ok maybe it didn’t say that his parents said to say directly in the bible, but what parent wouldn’t). That is one of the ten commandments, and your savior broke it.[/quote]

Adam and Eve could have had unmentioned daughters. Because women belong in the kitchen and bedroom, not the Bible.

First of all, he is the Son of God. So of course he would know the law and the Torah, that’s the entire point. Also, by schooling the teachers of the law, is that not honoring his parents? I agree, it’s a weak hole.

Silver Lining:

Monotheism vs. the trinity. Supposed omniscience when, in the Bible (King James version), “God” has to ask where Abel is.

The point of the trinity is the fact that God is triune. You cannot ignore the ‘-une’ suffix. Also, Asking a question does not imply ignorance of the answer.

dragonus18:

and “satan” does nothing wrong in the bible, like with adam and eve, all he did was give them knowledge.

No, what he did wrong was disobey God.

Buzzy:

In other words, the bible is saying ignorance is bliss.

Can you honestly say you’re happier with knowledge?

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Winter Solstice!
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:16, topic:167284”][quote author=Silver Lining link=topic=226677.msg1952192#msg1952192 date=1198564392]
The “few holes” in Christianity? If we view Christianity as a ship, and its flaws as holes, you’ll find there’s less wood than there is holes from iron contradictions.
[/quote]

Give an example.[/quote]

I’ll give the two that I found when I was 11 years old and I started studying the bible.

Read genesis, it says that there were four people on earth when cain killed abel, correct? Well, how is it possible that cain killed abel and then left to marry a woman from another place, doesn’t make sense. I’ve heard that the counter argument to this is that in these times, daughters were not mentioned. I don’t buy that, when there’s 5 people on the entire planet, you better believe we’d account for everyone of them, not that we actually have any proof of “Adam and Eve”.

The second, and the one I found earlier on, in sunday school, is a weak hole, but a hole still the same. I can’t remember what book, but it says that jesus traveled to jerusalem with his parents when he was 12 years old, and they were walking through the city, when jesus left his parents, and went to a temple to preach to the religious people, I’m sure you heard this is where he magically picked out the scrolls of the torra as if he knew exactly where they were and preached the word. Well, what isn’t brought to your attention is that jesus left his parents when he was supposed to stay (yeah, ok maybe it didn’t say that his parents said to say directly in the bible, but what parent wouldn’t). That is one of the ten commandments, and your savior broke it.

Read full topic

I don’t bother researching holes in your religion, but instead I try to find holes in mine.

item.title: Happy Winter Solstice!
item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

1. Stop posting shit that you know no one else knows about to get attention.

i’m not the only spiritual satanist on this site, and I’m not doing this for attention, I’m doing it to check with the other people that celebrate it and seeing if they want to share what they are doing.

2. Do some research on other than your religion. How about instead of looking for strong points of satanism that leads people to follow the religion, look for the weak points that are said to be holes, to see if you can accept or disprove them to keep following your religion. There's been entire days where instead of researching wicca through my books, friends, and the internet, I research other religions that are said to have disproved the occult, and paganism. Learn from facts, not some free webs site that's said to have all the answers.

Like to share with me some of the holes in my religion?

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Winter Solstice!
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

Lol. I love your logic. The only thing that predates paganism is shamanism, and I’d follow their doctrine, the day I want to get beaten daily to achieve the same level of meditation I could from some incense, a blue candle, and a peaceful memory. I didn’t say that the general satanist dislikes pagans, I’m saying that christians and satanists both borrow pagan traditions for their own religion.

All I’m saying through these posts are:

  1. Stop posting shit that you know no one else knows about to get attention.
  2. Do some research on other than your religion. How about instead of looking for strong points of satanism that leads people to follow the religion, look for the weak points that are said to be holes, to see if you can accept or disprove them to keep following your religion. There’s been entire days where instead of researching wicca through my books, friends, and the internet, I research other religions that are said to have disproved the occult, and paganism. Learn from facts, not some free webs site that’s said to have all the answers.

Read full topic
